snippet: The Troubled Asset Relief Program was an essential piece of a necessary evil, but it was put in place in a way that was excessively favorable to the very bankers who had presided over the collapse, Simon Johnson argues in The New York Times's...
abstract: The Troubled Asset Relief Program was an essential piece of a necessary evil, but it was put in place in a way that was excessively favorable to the very bankers who had presided over the collapse, Simon Johnson argues in The New York Times's Economix blog.
